intro: Jonthlaspi lanuginosum, commonly known as the silky whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas, meadows, and along roadsides. Jonthlaspi lanuginosum is a perennial herb that is well adapted to temperate climates.
